text: No one's been like Rhobb, such a King Pin like Rhobb..
With a single swipe Rhobb breaks both tree and rock.
His secret? About fourty gallons a day.
Revered amongst Slayers, Rhobb wears his token with pride.
Thulgrim may snatch your belongings before you even shout ''Thief!''.
''Oh this? No this was all acquired.. Legitimately''.
It's not the size of the sword that counts, it's how you wield it.
Is it shiny? Is it valueable? Thulgrim'll take it.
None as stout and brave as the one and only Ensun, slayer of foul.
A source of inspiration for all maids, Ensun's name is carried with awe.
The finest mail gifted by one of her many suitors.
The strongest of Runesmiths woe her with runes of old.
Obtained on one of her many adventures, her weaponry ooze exotic powers.
Those undefeated by men better watch out..
''Here, take another! The drunker you are the easier to rob''.
Time is money, and money is time.
Armour? Who requires armour if you bolster a torso as fine as Rhobb's.
With force and strength Rhobb smites his foes like ragdolls.
There are but few dwarves that have the sheer strength to lift Rhobb's axe, even fewer to tale the tale after they had to parry it.
Battle? What a waste of time better spent thieving somewhere else.
Dwarves eagerly follow Ensun in to battle, and anywhere else quite frankly.
Rumoured to have shot the lid of a Bugman barrel from over a thousand yards, Gargul surely is a master gunner.
With his fabled tescope Gargul spots his targets hours before they even know he is there.
His rifle as steady as the sturdiest of Laurelorn trees - a weapon of pure brilliance.
Gargul crafts a particular mixture of powder and herbs, causing his weaponry to carry explosive tendencies.
All his kin know he's not a real wizard, making his dramatic act all the more frustrating for his Dawi brethren.
Wundal claims he has the original Great Book of Grudges, and all the Dwarven Kings carry copies. It looks just like a plain old book however.
Wundal flexes his trinkets to any innocent bystander, claiming their worth is beyond compare.
Wundal's hat does appear to hold some magic tendencies, which instantly points to the fact he stole it from an actual wizard.
Skargell is a master Miner who has dug in mountains from Ind to the very planes of Frost themselves.
A master miner fears nothing but the prospect of being prospectless.
With the rarest of steel one forges the sturdiest of equipment.
Skargell has explored mines from the far north to the distant south in search of treasure and minerals.
Skargel has commanded many carts on explorations in uncharted mines and caverns.
The best miners know exactly where to strike to make the sturdiest of stone crack with a single well placed strike.
Wundal claims he retrieved ancient Dwarven runes from a lost Karak, they look just look regular stones however.
Nobody knows exactly where Wundal retrieves his frogs from, that they are poisonous is a fact however.
Dynamite crafted from the finest powder makes the tallest mountain go ''Boom''.
Suresight is required for a true Master Gunner.
